name: ManojList
tagline: List of allow, block and ignore requests to third party websites which are irrelevant to content of the website for the end user.
body:
## Objective
To provide a **safe** and **lean** web experience

## Desired Outcome
To achieve the stated objective, we'll focus on four major areas of the websites. First is anti-tracking, second is performance, third is transparency and the fourth is blocking irreverent content and no moral policing.

## Why not Disconnect, Adblock Plus, Ghostery and similar products 
Reverse approach, no **"allowed"** ads/tracking and transparent. 

## Author/Contributor
In 2015, Manoj Garg (@TheManojGarg) started ManojList. Please consider helping those who spend their time, energy and creativity to make this world a better place.

## Support
Having trouble with something? Consider raising an [issue](https://github.com/TheManojGarg/ManojList/issues) and we’ll help you sort it out.

## Page Design
This page is authored using GitHub Flavored [Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/). You can also check out the new `gh-pages` branch locally. If you’re using GitHub Desktop, simply sync your repository and you’ll see the new branch. GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
